IncidentDef.label: Favor
IncidentDef.description: Make a sacrifice without any worldly gains.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to be noticed
IncidentDef.letterText: felt a supernatural presence connect with them from beyond space and time

IncidentDef.label: Psionic Growth
IncidentDef.description: Generates a tumorous growth within the brain of the colonist granting them a powerful psionic melee attack.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to be endowed with psychic power
IncidentDef.letterText: felt an intense pressure in their skull and looked on the world with new and strange eyes

IncidentDef.label: Aspect of Cthulhu
IncidentDef.description: The spell targets one of your colonists and remanifests one of their limbs as a powerful tentacle.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to be endowed with otherworldly parts
IncidentDef.letterText: looked around nervously to find who had been endowed with Cthulhu's blessings

IncidentDef.label: Orbital Insanity Wave
IncidentDef.description: Causes a massive wave through the orbital layer of the region. This will cause ships to crash in the vicinity.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to send his dreams into the void as a beacon to those who pass
IncidentDef.letterText: felt Cthulhu reach out and draw in vessels for your plunder

IncidentDef.label: Terrestrial Insanity Wave
IncidentDef.description: Causes a massive wave through the terrestrial layer of the region. All enemy humanoid pawns will be riddled with a crippling form of insanity.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and ask that he sends your foes into disarray
IncidentDef.letterText: cries out with victorious glee as Cthulhu sends their enemies deep into madness

IncidentDef.label: Awaken Cthulhu
IncidentDef.description: [Game Ending Spell]\nThe effects of Cthulhu’s awakening are unknown.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to awaken him from his eon long slumber and start his reign over the physical world
IncidentDef.letterText: feels a clawing at their mind as the great Cthulhu awakens. Realities' skin stretches thinner and thinner.

IncidentDef.label: Sunken Ship
IncidentDef.description: Delivers an ancient wreck from a distant seabed to your colony that can provide wood, steel, plasteel, and components when dismantled.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: out of desperation or greed, to deliver wealth from the sea
IncidentDef.letterText: is granted a vision of mists unveiling a wreckage from the sea

IncidentDef.label: Treasures of the Deep
IncidentDef.description: Brings forth lost treasure chests filled with valuable resources such as jade, silver, and gold from ancient ships lost to the abyssal seas.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: out of desperation or greed, to deliver wealth from the sea
IncidentDef.letterText: later finds chests of treasure with only damp handprints as evidence of those who left it

IncidentDef.label: Defend the Brood
IncidentDef.description: Brings a gang of deep ones to stand guard over your colony. Placement of the Sign of Dagon before casting this spell is recommended.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and ask that he protect his own
IncidentDef.letterText: hears a croaking off in the distance. And then another, and then a chorus

IncidentDef.label: Bounty of the Sea
IncidentDef.description: Dagon tears a ship from the surface of a distant ocean and delivers its fresh corpse.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: out of desperation or greed, to deliver wealth from the sea
IncidentDef.letterText: hears a crash, then screaming, as the prize is delivered

IncidentDef.label: Orthogenesis
IncidentDef.description: [Game Ending Spell]\nA path to the great cities of the Deep Ones will be revealed to your colony, and they can begin the merger with the Deep Ones and become one with Dagon’s flock.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to deliver his blessing and grants an invitation to join him
IncidentDef.letterText: hears the call, a long and deep croak, roll over the land. A call beckoning them back to the sea

IncidentDef.label: Fertility Ritual
IncidentDef.description: Summons a fertility totem to support your colony’s fields through hard times.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to bless their crops
IncidentDef.letterText: witnesses fully formed black goats and a totem rising from the remains of the sacrifice

IncidentDef.label: Mother Of Goats
IncidentDef.description: Summons a herd of black goats to provide your hunters with ample prey to hunt.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to bless them with prey
IncidentDef.letterText: can hear the wild screams of goats in the distance

IncidentDef.label: Transmogrify Pets
IncidentDef.description: Allow Shub-Niggurath to reseed the genetic structure of your beloved pet with extra-dimensional code worthy of Shub-Niggurath’s own spawn.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to bless their beasts with a touch of its extra-dimensional biology
IncidentDef.letterText: looks on as the skin of the chosen creature bulges and writhes with the ongoing changes beneath. It returns the gaze and bleats impassively

IncidentDef.label: Womb Between Worlds
IncidentDef.description: Summons a portal that spews Dark Young monsters to serve you as their loyal master until Shub-Niggurath deems otherwise.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to summon powerful allies
IncidentDef.letterText: beholds vine-like tentacles erupt from the ground. The earth heaves and splits open as it gives birth to a new monstrous form

IncidentDef.label: Transdimensional Convergence
IncidentDef.description: [Game Ending Spell]\nAllow Shub-Niggurath to enter this dimension fully-formed at the cost of mutating the biology of your entire region.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and attempt to break down the barriers and open the way
IncidentDef.letterText: rends the barriers and unfolds the higher dimensions, bringing the Mother Goddess into this lowly place

IncidentDef.label: Starry Wisdom
IncidentDef.description: Transforms your executioner’s mind into a psychopathic one. Psychopaths will also be turned cannibalistic.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and give the dark one its toll of dreams in exchange for illumination
IncidentDef.letterText: has their mind open to the truth

IncidentDef.label: Forbidden Knowledge
IncidentDef.description: Grants a sizable bonus to your current research project.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and ask that he grants forbidden knowledge
IncidentDef.letterText: hears dark secrets scratched in the air by a whisper

IncidentDef.label: Chaos Theory
IncidentDef.description: Accept a deal from Nyarlathotep to live one’s life again. This removes all incapabilities from the executioner and changes their entire backstory.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and petition for another chance to correct mistakes from the past
IncidentDef.letterText: is sent back in time to before their birth to relive their life again

IncidentDef.label: Dark Emissary
IncidentDef.description: A new cult member joins your colony.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: to bolster your ranks with his favoured
IncidentDef.letterText: can sense a visitor's arrival

IncidentDef.label: Pilgrimage to Kadath
IncidentDef.description: [Game Ending Spell]\nWill you join Nyarlathotep in the dreamworld?
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and ask that he illuminate the path to one of his many thrones
IncidentDef.letterText: finds themselves at the start of a long path, with a stranger ahead, beckoning

IncidentDef.label: The King in Yellow, Act I
IncidentDef.description: Acquire a reproduction of the infamous play, "The King in Yellow." Those exposed to the contents therin are downed and become cult-minded instantly.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and petition him to whisper the tale of the the Visitor, who wears no mask, and the doom that followed
IncidentDef.letterText: smiles with eagerness. They cannot wait to see how the play ends this time

IncidentDef.label: Summon Byakhee
IncidentDef.description: Summon a byakhee for defense and transport.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and beseech that he sends one of his hideous star-dwelling steeds
IncidentDef.letterText: hears unearthly screams and the beating of leathery wings from above

IncidentDef.label: The King in Yellow, Act II
IncidentDef.description: A proportion of the inhabitants will fall to dream of the lost city of Carcosa for 5-6 hours and shall awaken deeply calmed for a season.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and petition him for visions of the spires and balustrades of the distant and lost city of Carcosa
IncidentDef.letterText: feels the tendrils of sleep weave its way into their mind, to pull them away to distant Haydes, where Carcosa sits under black stars

IncidentDef.label: Unspeakable Oath
IncidentDef.description: When the oathtaker dies, they return to life once again to serve.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and swear and an unbreakable oath on his unspoken name
IncidentDef.letterText: realises that they are the only one who notices the masked stranger, slender in their yellow robes, and realises that their life is no longer their own

IncidentDef.label: Absorption by Carcosa
IncidentDef.description: [Game Ending Spell]\nThe small settlement is deemed worthy by Hastur to enter his realm and be absorbed by the city of Carcosa.
IncidentDef.letterLabel: and cry out in supplication that he may gaze upon your small settlement and deem you worthy
IncidentDef.letterText: dons a mask and so is free

IncidentDef.label: Double The Fun
IncidentDef.letterText: A flashstorm has struck the region

IncidentDef.label: Reanimator
IncidentDef.letterText: Your sacrifice has risen from the dead

IncidentDef.label: Flashstorm
IncidentDef.letterText: A flashstorm has struck the region

IncidentDef.label: Ecstatic Frenzy
IncidentDef.letterText: Through the fervor of their ritual, your cultists have gone wild, thrashing at one another like animals

IncidentDef.label: Summoned Star Vampire
IncidentDef.letterText: A star vampire pierces the veil of our reality

IncidentDef.label: Blight
IncidentDef.letterText: A blight strikes your fields

IncidentDef.label: No Longer Domesticated
IncidentDef.letterText: Some of your animals have gone feral with madness

IncidentDef.label: Eclipse
IncidentDef.letterLabel: Eclipse
IncidentDef.letterText: Unseen forces have forced one of the moons of this planet in front of the sun. An eclipse has begun

IncidentDef.label: Food Spoilage
IncidentDef.letterText: Some of your food stores have mysteriously become rotten and inedible

IncidentDef.label: Reincarnation
IncidentDef.letterText: The sacrifice has resurged with branches, trunk, and tree parts, destroying your altar. Upon its form is a wicked visage of the departed

IncidentDef.label: Aurora
IncidentDef.letterText: A magnificent aurora gracefully passes overhead

MapConditionDef.label: Aurora
MapConditionDef.description: An absurdly beautiful aurora lays across the sky. Your colonists feel elated at the sight.

IncidentDef.label: Need a Hand
IncidentDef.letterText: One of the congregation finds, to their horror, that their body has been altered

IncidentDef.label: Rats in the Walls
IncidentDef.letterText: Scutting, scratching sounds hail the arrival of countless rats bursting through the floorboards

IncidentDef.label: Debug: Spawn Cult Preacher
IncidentDef.letterText: DEBUG - THIS SHOULD NEVER HAPPEN
